title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement paul.govan2@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: Crow-AMSAA Non-Homogeneous Poisson Process (NHPP) model statistical model used track reliability improvements time. model particularly useful analyzing failure data systems failure rate changes due improvements corrective actions development operational phase.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: NHPP, failure rate changes time, increasing decreasing depending actions taken improve reliability. Failures follow Poisson process, rate occur changes time, hence “non-homogeneous.”

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: failure intensity (rate failures per time unit) modeled power function time: λ(t)=β⋅tβ−1 \lambda(t) = \beta \cdot t^{\beta - 1} : λ(t)\lambda(t) failure intensity time tt, β\beta shape parameter, tt time. cumulative number failures time tt given : N(t)=λ0⋅tβ N(t) = \lambda_0 \cdot t^{\beta} : N(t)N(t) cumulative number failures, λ0\lambda_0 scale parameter.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: Shape Parameter (β\beta) indicates whether system improving deteriorating: β\beta > 1, failures increasing time, indicating reliability worsening. β\beta < 1, failures decreasing, indicating reliability improving time. β\beta = 1 implies constant failure rate (growth degradation). Scale Parameter (λ0\lambda_0) related initial failure rate.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: First, load package: Next, set cumulative time failure data: run rga plot results:
code: library(ReliaGrowR) times <- c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500) failures <- c(1, 2, 1, 3, 2) result <- rga(times, failures) plot_rga(result)

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: Piecewise Weibull NHPP model extension standard NHPP model includes different segments phases time follow separate Weibull failure distributions. model particularly useful system experiences changes failure behavior different development phases, initial, interim final phases development process.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: Weibull intensity function time segment ii modeled : λi(t)=βiηi(t−ti−1ηi)βi−1 \lambda_i(t) = \frac{\beta_i}{\eta_i} \left( \frac{t - t_{-1}}{\eta_i} \right)^{\beta_i - 1} : λi(t)\lambda_i(t) failure intensity time interval ii, βi\beta_i shape parameter interval ii, ηi\eta_i scale parameter (characteristic life) interval ii, ti−1t_{-1} start time interval.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: First, set cumulative time/failure data specify breakpoint: run rga plot results:
code: times <- c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, 1000) failures <- c(1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 2, 3, 1, 2, 4) breakpoints <- 400 result <- rga(times, failures, model_type = "Piecewise Weibull NHPP", breakpoints = breakpoints) plot_rga(result)

what: The Piecewise Weibull NHPP with Change Point Detection
title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: Piecewise Weibull NHPP Change Point Detection advanced model identify changes failure behavior model system reliability. method builds Piecewise Weibull NHPP model introducing concept change points, represent time underlying failure behavior changes. Detection change points involves statistical techniques analyze failure data automatically identify behavior changes, allowing precise segmentation model different Weibull distributions.

previous_headings: The Piecewise Weibull NHPP with Change Point Detection
title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: First, set cumulative time failure data: run rga plot results:
code: times <- c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, 1000) failures <- c(1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 2, 3, 1, 2, 4) result <- rga(times, failures, model_type = "Piecewise Weibull NHPP") plot_rga(result)

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: Duane Model another graphical method track visualize reliability improvement product system time. Duane Plot log-log plot shows cumulative failure rate Mean Time Failures (MTBF) versus time, helping assess whether reliability improving, stabilizing, worsening time.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: First, set cumulative time failure data: plot results:
code: times <- c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500) failures <- c(1, 2, 1, 3, 2) fit <- duane_plot(times, failures)

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: RGA provides quantitative framework understanding system’s reliability changes time guides decisions improvements based observed failure patterns.

text: install release version ReliaGrowR, use: can install development version ReliaGrowR like :

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: basic example Reliability Growth Analysis: First, load package: Next, set cumulative time failure data: run rga plot results:
code: library(ReliaGrowR) times <- c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500) failures <- c(1, 2, 1, 3, 2) result <- rga(times, failures) plot_rga(result)

what: Plotting Function for Duane Analysis. — duane_plot
title: Plotting Function for Duane Analysis. — duane_plot
text: Plotting Function Duane Analysis.

title: Plotting Function for Duane Analysis. — duane_plot
code: duane_plot(   times,   failures,   plot = TRUE,   point_col = "black",   line_col = "black",   xlab = "Cumulative Time",   ylab = "Cumulative MTBF",   main = "Duane Plot with Cumulative MTBF" )

title: Plotting Function for Duane Analysis. — duane_plot
text: times vector cumulative times failures occurred. failures vector number failures corresponding time times. plot Show Duane Plot (TRUE) hide plot (FALSE). point_col Color data points (default: "black"). line_col Color fitted line (default: "black"). xlab Label x-axis (default: "Cumulative Time"). ylab Label y-axis (default: "Cumulative MTBF"). main Title plot (default: "Duane Plot Cumulative MTBF").

title: Plotting Function for Duane Analysis. — duane_plot
text: function returns list fitted linear model, Cumulative Time, Cumulative MTBF.

title: Plotting Function for Duane Analysis. — duane_plot
code: library(ReliaGrowR) times <- c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500) failures <- c(1, 2, 1, 3, 2) fit <- duane_plot(times, failures)  summary(fit) #>                 Length Class  Mode    #> model           12     lm     list    #> AIC              1     -none- numeric #> BIC              1     -none- numeric #> Cumulative_Time  5     -none- numeric #> Cumulative_MTBF  5     -none- numeric #> Fitted_Values    5     -none- numeric

what: Plotting Function for Reliability Growth Analysis — plot_rga
title: Plotting Function for Reliability Growth Analysis — plot_rga
text: Plotting Function Reliability Growth Analysis

title: Plotting Function for Reliability Growth Analysis — plot_rga
code: plot_rga(   rga_obj,   point_col = "black",   line_col = "black",   xlab = "Cumulative Time",   ylab = "Cumulative Failures",   main = "Reliability Growth Analysis" )

title: Plotting Function for Reliability Growth Analysis — plot_rga
text: rga_obj object class rga, contains results RGA model. point_col Color data points (default: "black"). line_col Color fitted line (default: "black"). xlab Label x-axis (default: "Cumulative Time"). ylab Label y-axis (default: "Cumulative Failures"). main Title plot (default: "Reliability Growth Analysis").

title: Plotting Function for Reliability Growth Analysis — plot_rga
text: function return value.

title: Plotting Function for Reliability Growth Analysis — plot_rga
code: times <- c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500) failures <- c(1, 2, 1, 3, 2) result <- rga(times, failures) plot_rga(result)

title: Reliability Growth Analysis. — rga
text: Reliability Growth Analysis.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis. — rga
code: rga(   times,   failures,   model_type = "Crow-AMSAA",   breakpoints = NULL,   conf_level = 0.95 )

title: Reliability Growth Analysis. — rga
text: times vector cumulative times failures occurred. failures vector number failures corresponding time times. model_type model type. Either Crow-AMSAA (default) Piecewise Weibull NHPP change point detection. breakpoints optional vector breakpoints Piecewise Weibull NHPP model. conf_level desired confidence level, defaults 95%.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis. — rga
text: function returns object class rga contains results model.

what: Convert Weibull Data to Reliability Growth Data — weibull_to_rga
title: Convert Weibull Data to Reliability Growth Data — weibull_to_rga
text: Convert Weibull Data Reliability Growth Data

title: Convert Weibull Data to Reliability Growth Data — weibull_to_rga
Convert Weibull Data to Reliability Growth Data — weibull_to_rga
text: failures vector failure times. suspensions vector suspension (censoring) times.

title: Convert Weibull Data to Reliability Growth Data — weibull_to_rga
text: data frame times failure counts suitable reliability growth analysis.

title: Convert Weibull Data to Reliability Growth Data — weibull_to_rga
code: failures <- c(100, 200, 200, 400) suspensions <- c(250, 350, 450) result <- weibull_to_rga(failures, suspensions) print(result) #>   CumulativeTime Failures #> 1            100        1 #> 2            300        2 #> 6           1500        1
